utilities.tweetshandling

Class TwitterTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • utilities.tweetshandling.TwitterTools

  • public class TwitterTools
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class which contains tools regarding search on the Twitter API.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TwitterTools() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void filterTweetsBasedOnCity(java.util.List<twitter4j.Status> tweets, java.lang.String city)
      For every status in the list, if the statu's place or the user's place does not equal the city given then that status is removed from the list.
      static twitter4j.Query queryMaker(java.lang.String keywords, java.util.Date since, java.util.Date until, int count)
      Creates a query based on the filters that were given.
      static java.util.List<twitter4j.Status> search(twitter4j.Query query)
      Gets the maximum number of tweets with the query given from the API.

        public TwitterTools()

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public static java.util.List<twitter4j.Status> search(twitter4j.Query query)
        Gets the maximum number of tweets with the query given from the API.
        Parameters:
        query - the query that was given
        Returns:
        a list of Status that were downloaded

      • filterTweetsBasedOnCity

        public static void filterTweetsBasedOnCity(java.util.List<twitter4j.Status> tweets,
                                           java.lang.String city)
        For every status in the list, if the statu's place or the user's place does not equal the city given then that status is removed from the list.
        Parameters:
        tweets - the list of tweets
        city - the city to filter the list by

      • queryMaker

        public static twitter4j.Query queryMaker(java.lang.String keywords,
                                         java.util.Date since,
                                         java.util.Date until,
                                         int count)
        Creates a query based on the filters that were given. If no keywords were given then the letter 'a' is used as a keyword since the Twitter API does not support empty queries.
        Parameters:
        keywords - keywords to search in the API
        since - starting date to find tweets from
        until - ending date to find tweets from
        count - maximum number of tweets to return per page (max 100)
        Returns:
        the query with the filters set
